items.summary: IDF soldier Yonatan Karten, present at the event, described the confrontation as an 'attempted lynching' while defending attendees. The counter-protest, organized by Students for Justice in Palestine, led to several students requiring hospital treatment

items.title: Trump says Kazakhstan to join Abraham Accords: 'Many more countries to join this club of strength'
items.summary: U.S. President spoke to PM Netanyahu and Kazakh President Tokayev, whose country already has full ties with Israel; Trump added that the White House would soon announce 'a signing ceremony to make it official'

items.title: 'They want me in jail': The real target of Netanyahu's coalition in IDF leak scandal
items.summary: The leak and cover-up overseen by the IDF's top lawyer caused immense damage, but the outrage of the members of the criminal organization known as the Netanyahu coalition is nothing more than a performance. Their real target is the attorney general

items.title: Nancy Pelosi, first woman to serve as U.S. House speaker, to retire from Congress
items.summary: The former speaker announced that she will not run for re-election to Congress in 2026, ending a four-decade career. 'With a grateful heart, I look forward to my final year of service,' she said, amid criticism from younger Democrats that their elders were hanging onto power

items.title: Israeli army strikes Hezbollah targets across southern Lebanon
items.summary: The IDF Arabic-language spokesperson issued warnings to residents to evacuate their homes in preparation for Israeli strikes. Lebanese sources told Haaretz that the escalation is intended to pressure the Lebanese government to open diplomatic negotiations with Israel

items.title: Paramount Studios reportedly keeps internal blacklist of antisemitic industry figures
items.summary: This follows Paramount's public rejection of a boycott against Israeli film institutions, a stance backed by new CEO David Ellison, the son of tech magnate Larry Ellison, who has taken bold steps to reshape the company, including acquisitions and staff overhauls

items.title: Police fail to curb Israeli violence against Palestinian bus drivers in Jerusalem
items.summary: In the span of 24 hours, passengers attacked drivers in nine separate incidents in Jerusalem earlier this week. Union data shows attacks have increased by 30 percent, with more than 100 incidents reported this year, but they say the police aren't doing enough to stop it

items.title: A leak, a cover-up and the battle for Israel's rule of law: the Sde Teiman Affair explained
Israeli media's reaction to Mamdani: a caricature of an antisemite
items.summary: The socialist elected mayor of New York City, Zohran Mamdani, is not dangerous to Israel. He is dangerous to the lie Israel tells itself

items.title: Why did so many Jews vote for Mamdani?
items.summary: For the incoming mayor's supporters, it was about economics. For Jews, it was about values, and Israel should beware

items.title: What Israel's opposition should learn from Mamdani
items.summary: While New Yorkers rallied around an idealist unafraid to be called radical, Israel's opposition leaders shrink from saying what they stand for, beyond replacing Netanyahu

items.title: Justice ministry sources: AG to hand over investigation into prisoner abuse video leak
items.summary: Sources say Gali Baharav-Miara is expected to transfer the investigation over to the State Prosecutor's Office, after the Justice Ministry's legal adviser submitted a legal opinion and cited the AG's conflict of interest

items.title: The Talmud and the case of the unexpected egg
items.summary: What one small question about a chicken and an egg reveals about Jewish law, consciousness, and sacred time.

items.title: Miss Universe contestants stage walkout after organiser berates Miss Mexico
items.summary: Miss Mexico, Fatima Bosch, said Nawat Itsaragrisil was 'not respectful' at a pre-pageant ceremony on Tuesday

items.title: Watch: What New Yorkers want Mamdani to do as mayor
items.summary: The 34-year-old will become the city's first Muslim mayor and the youngest in more than a century when he is sworn in on 1 January 2026.
